questions.question: What is the title of the article that discusses the structural study of a copper-uridine octamer?
questions.answer: An unusual copper-uridine octamer: existence in solution and structural study in its auto-built zeolitic network in the solid state

questions.question: Who are the authors of the article published on May 1, 2002, in the Journal of the American Chemical Society?
questions.answer: J. Galy, A. Mosset, I. Grenthe, I. Puigdomenech, B. Sjoeberg, F. Hulten

questions.question: In which volume and issue of the Journal of the American Chemical Society was the article about the copper-uridine octamer published?
What is the DOI of the article discussing the existence in solution and structural study of a copper-uridine octamer?
What is the publication date of the article with the DOI 10.1021/ja00236a015 in the Journal of the American Chemical Society?
What is the range of pages for the article titled 'An unusual copper-uridine octamer' in the Journal of the American Chemical Society?
Based on the publication date, can it be inferred that the research on the copper-uridine octamer was conducted in the 21st century?
questions.answer: Yes, since the publication date is May 1, 2002.

questions.question: Considering the authors listed, who contributed to the article but is not the first author?
questions.answer: A. Mosset is one of the contributors who is not the first author.

questions.question: If one wanted to cite this article, which detail is unnecessary to include based on standard citation practices?
questions.answer: The day of publication is unnecessary; typically, only the year is required.

questions.question: How many authors contributed to the study of the copper-uridine octamer according to the article metadata?
questions.answer: Six authors contributed to the study.

questions.question: Is the article focused on a theoretical study or an experimental study based on the title?
questions.answer: The article focuses on an experimental study, as indicated by the mention of 'structural study' and 'existence in solution'.

questions.question: What can be inferred about the significance of the copper-uridine octamer from the article's title?
questions.answer: The copper-uridine octamer is significant due to its unusual properties and its ability to form an auto-built zeolitic network in the solid state.

questions.question: The article was published in the Journal of the American Chemical Society.
The article was first published electronically on January 1, 1987.
questions.answer: False, it was first published electronically on May 1, 2002.

questions.question: The article discusses the structural study of a copper-uridine octamer in both solution and solid state.
The article has more than five authors.
The article was published in the 20th century.
questions.answer: False, it was published in the 21st century.

questions.question: The article spans over 10 pages.
questions.answer: False, it spans over 7 pages (from 380 to 386).
